Below is a simple HTML file that creates a WebVR scene using A-Frame. This scene features a blue sky and green grass. The sky is represented by a large, semi-transparent sphere to give a feeling of openness, while the grass is depicted on a flat plane.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Blue Sky and Green Grass in A-Frame</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
        body { margin: 0; }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <a-scene>
        <!-- Sky -->
        <a-sky color="#87CEEB"></a-sky>

        <!-- Ground (Grass) -->
        <a-plane position="0 0 -5" rotation="-90 0 0" width="20" height="20" color="#228B22"></a-plane>

        <!-- Camera -->
        <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 2"></a-entity>
    </a-scene>
</body>
</html>
```

### Explanation:

1. **A-Frame Setup**: The script includes the A-Frame library to make use of its capabilities for creating 3D scenes.

2. **Sky**: The `<a-sky>` element creates a blue sky, with the color set to a sky blue (#87CEEB).

3. **Ground (Grass)**: The `<a-plane>` element represents the ground covered with green grass, using a rich green color (#228B22). It's positioned below the sky, and we rotate it to lie flat on the ground.

4. **Camera**: The camera is positioned slightly above the ground level, allowing the viewer to look around the scene.

You can save this code as an `.html` file and open it in a web browser that supports A-Frame to see a simple VR environment with a blue sky and green grass.
